column4: please some 1 help me my interenet is really not working in ubuntu
network card is onboard  nforce networking controller
i am new to linux which distro will you guys recommend me.?
whats the difference between fedora n ubuntu

the majority are easy to install these days and easy to use so it doesent really matter check distro watch have a read see which one you fancy really, the only ones not for noobs is slackware and maybe arch
the main diffs fedora is blleding edge they update packages without considering stability (as its red hats test platform) they use rpm instead of deb
if you have got used to mandriva then fedora might be your best bet as like mandriva is based on red hat
if you want to try ubuntu I suggest 10.04
can your network adapters handle 4 gig?
use the one ending -29 theres been 2 relesed since
if you want to troubleshoot properly use the older kernel and work from there
reinstall you did soemething wrong last time getting to the bottom of what would take longer than a reinstall
top and copy the main bit at the top if that makes any sense
if you cant get ubuntu to work forget Linux
stick to what works for you then learn Linux more then decide
